info.description:
Account Financials European Union (EU) provides customer-authorized, account-specific data for all American Express® proprietary Card products including Personal, Small Business and Corporate Cards for parties certified under the Payment Service Directive 2 (PSD2) legislation.

Available for:
Account Information Service Providers (AISPs) in Europe and the UK who have been authorised by their national competent authorities, and AISPs who have applied for such authorisation.

Jurisdictions:
American Express Customers in the UK and France.

Download API Specification
info.title: Account Financials European Union (EU)

get.description: Returns the Card Member Account information for the requested Card/Account based on the secured input token.

parameters.name: supplementary_account_filter
parameters.description: By default, the response includes all the supplementary accounts. And if the value passed is exclude_supplementary_accounts, then the API excludes supplementary accounts in the response.

x-amex-request-id.description: An echo of the x-amex-request-id passed in the header of the request.

400.description:
Bad Request. Input validation failed. The following error codes are related to invalid authorization (access token validation).

CodeMessage
154000Request MAC is not matching with Generated MAC.

x-amex-request-id.description: An echo back of the x-amex-request-id passed in the header of the request.

get.description: Returns the balances information for the requested Card/Account based on the secured input token.

parameters.name: statement_end_date
parameters.description: The statement end date for which the balances are requested. In case this is not passed then current balances will be returned by default. The input for this parameter can be determined from the statement_periods (end_date) API. The format is YYYY-MM-DD.

x-amex-request-id.description: An echo of the x-amex-request-id passed in the header of the request.

400.description:
Bad Request. Input validation failed.
Access Token Validation Error Codes

CodeMessage
154000Request MAC is not matching with Generated MAC.

Data API Error Codes

CodeMessage
3003The date format should be YYYY-MM-DD.
3004Invalid date range. Please check start_date and end_date values.
3005Invalid pagination. Please check the offset and limit values.
3027Requested date range exceeds the supported limit.
3028Invalid extended_details. Please check the input values. The allowed value is Merchant.

x-amex-request-id.description: An echo back of the x-amex-request-id passed in the header of the request.

get.description: Returns the list of all posted transactions for the requested Card/Account, based on the secured input token. This API is supported for either a statement/billing period or a date range (maximum of 90 days).

parameters.name: statement_end_date
parameters.description: The statement end date for which the transactions are requested. In case this is not passed, this API would return the transactions that got posted after the last statement cut. The input for this parameter can be determined from the statement_periods (end_date) API. The format is YYYY-MM-DD.

parameters.name: start_date
parameters.description: The date from which transactions are requested (inclusive). For a date range request, populate both the start and end date and do not use statement_end_date. The format is YYYY-MM-DD.

parameters.name: end_date
parameters.description: The date up to which transactions are requested (inclusive). For a date range request, populate both the start and end date and do not use statement_end_date. The format is YYYY-MM-DD.

parameters.name: offset
parameters.description: Offset and limit parameters support pagination. Specify offset to indicate the start index for pagination. The default offset is 0.

parameters.name: limit
parameters.description: Offset and limit parameters support pagination. Specify a limit to indicate the page size. The default limit is 10 and the maximum is 100.

parameters.name: extended_details
parameters.description: These are the sub-resources associated with the transactions. These are comma-separated. Currently allowed values include: Merchant.

x-amex-request-id.description: An echo of the x-amex-request-id passed in the header of the request.

400.description:
Bad Request. Input validation failed.
Access Token Validation Error Codes

CodeMessage
154000Request MAC is not matching with Generated MAC.

Data API Error Codes

CodeMessage
3003The date format should be YYYY-MM-DD.
3004Invalid date range. Please check start_date and end_date values.
3005Invalid pagination. Please check the offset and limit values.
3027Requested date range exceeds the supported limit.
3028Invalid extended_details. Please check the input values. The allowed value is Merchant.

x-amex-request-id.description: An echo back of the x-amex-request-id passed in the header of the request.

get.description: Returns core transaction details for the given identifier (identifier) for the requested Card/Account, based on the secured input token.

parameters.name: identifier
parameters.description: The unique identifier of the transaction for which additional attributes are being requested.

parameters.name: statement_end_date
parameters.description: The statement end date for which the transactions are requested. In case this is not passed, this API would return the transactions that were posted after the last statement cut-off date. The input for this parameter can be determined from the statement_periods (end_date) API. The format is YYYY-MM-DD.

parameters.name: start_date
parameters.description: The date from which transactions are requested (inclusive). For a date range request, populate both the start and end date and do not use statement_end_date. The format is YYYY-MM-DD.

parameters.name: end_date
parameters.description: The date up to which transactions are requested (inclusive). For a date range request, populate both the start and end date and do not use statement_end_date. The format is YYYY-MM-DD.

parameters.name: extended_details
parameters.description: These are the sub-resources associated with the transactions. These are comma-separated. Currently allowed values include: Merchant

x-amex-request-id.description: An echo of the x-amex-request-id passed in the header of the request.

400.description:

Access Token Validation Error Codes

CodeMessage

CodeMessage

3004Invalid date range. Please check start_date and end_date values.
3005Invalid pagination. Please check the offset and limit values.
3027Requested date range exceeds the supported limit.
3028Invalid extended_details. Please check the input values. The allowed value is Merchant.

supplementary_accounts.description: To allocate a defined number of additional supplemental accounts.

display_account_number.description: A masked, 15-digit Account Number with only the last five (5) digits provided for display purposes.

is_basic.description: Indicates whether the given Account token is basic or not.

supplementary_account_count.description: The count of supplementary accounts. This field is not available for international markets.

items.description:
Lists all benefits for which the selected Card is eligible.

e.g., LineOfCreditEligible

Lists all programs in which a selected Card is enrolled.

e.g., PaperlessEnrolled

status_fragment.description: Collected status information about Card Members, accounts and products.

items.description: Provides the status of a given Card Account, whether the Account is Active or Cancelled.

profile.description: Additional information about the Card Member's profile.

title_name.description: The Card Member's beginning Title/Rank can be used for pre-filling the Member profile, display purposes or communication purposes.

first_name.description: The Card Member's first name can be used for pre-filling the Member profile, display purposes, communication purposes and Card Member authorizations for Customer Care calls.

last_name.description: The Card Member's last name can be used for pre-filling the Member profile, display purposes, communication purposes and Card Member authorization for Customer Care calls.

embossed_name.description: The name of the Cardholder embossed on the plastic. The Embossed Name can be used for display and Card authorization purposes for online transactions.

localization_preferences.description: Collected identification information regarding the Card Member's location.

home_country_locale.description: The Card Member's preferred language locale. Locale can be used to display a page in the Card Member's preferred language or no Member-preferred language. The Locale value is a combination of language code, underscore and country code.

geo_country_locale.description: Geo Country Locale is a Card Member country locale. Locale can be used to identify the Card Member's home country.

language_preference_code.description: The language ISO code associated with the language used by the Card Member, whether it is the market’s primary or secondary language.

product_digital_info.description: Collected digital information about a Card product.

product_desc.description: Provides the information on a Card Product which can be used to identify product or display purposes.

digital_asset_url.description: The Digital Asset URL can be used to display the Card art image for a given product.

account_type.description: Descriptive information about a Card product type.

items.description:
Provides the Card type (plastic color) of a product for a given line-of-business account. The types currently include:

  • Centurion
  • Platinum

line_of_business_type.description:
Provides the product line-of-business for a given Card. The types currently include:

  • CorporateCard
  • ConsumerCard
  • CompanyCard

payment_type.description:
Provides a product payment type which tell what kind of payment model the Card is carrying. The types currently include:

  • ChargeCard
  • Revolve
  • LineOfCreditAccount
  • TermLoan
  • FlexiLoan

co_brand_type.description:
Provides a co-brand name which Amex is having a co-brand relation with external Partners.

e.g., Hilton

account_features.description: Lists all active features on a specified account.

features.description: Provides product features for which the product is enrolled.

feature.description: Information about the status and availability of program features.

loyalty_program.description: Descriptive information about loyalty programs in which the Card Account is enrolled.

program_name.description:
Provides the name of the loyalty program with which the Card is affiliated. The types currently include:

  • BlueSky
  • DFF2
  • MR
  • NewYork
  • JetBlue
  • Clear
  • FirstRepublicBank
  • Lowes
  • SkyMile

legal_program_name.description: Loyalty legal program name, such as 'Member Rewards'.

program_literal.description: If the loyalty program/rewards is FDMPASS, then FDMPASS is set in the program_literal field.

line_of_business.description: Provides Corporate or Open line-of-business product metadata.

name.description: Name of the corporation available for the Corporate Card.
Name of the company available for small business cards.

StatementPeriods.description: Statement periods information for any specific Card/Account.

start_date.description: The start date of the Statement/billing period. The format is YYYY-MM-DD.

end_date.description: The end date of the Statement/billing period. The format is YYYY-MM-DD.

index.description: The statement/billing period index/sequence number. Latest period is represented by index 0.

last_statement_balance_amount.description: The opening balance total amount. Outstanding balance at the time of cycle cut. This amount will be fully due to American Express if a charge product retains a balance, whereas if the funding source is a Revolve or Charge w/Payflex it will be used to calculate the minimum due.

statement_balance_amount.description: The closing balance total amount will be the sum of the Last Statement Balance and all recent activity, including debits and credits. This amount represents the total balance on the Account at a given point in time and is not the same as the Balance Due to American Express.

debits_balance_amount.description: The debits balance total amount, including purchases, fees, interest charges and loan installments that increased the balance on the account.

payments_credits_amount.description: The payments & credits balance total amount, including payment, credits, refunds or other transactions since the last statement date that reduced the balance on the account.

payment_due_amount.description: The minimum amount due for a revolve/flex Card and will be the payment due for the charge Cards.

payment_due_date.description: The latest date by which a payment must be made.

remaining_statement_balance_amount.description: The current balance, including dispute and credit adjustments.

Transactions.description: Contains the list of transactions for requested Account ID.

total_transaction_count.description: The total transactions count for the requested statement end.

Transaction.description: Includes the core elements of a transaction along with other extended details.

identifier.description: The unique identifier of the transaction record.

charge_date.description: The charge date of the transaction. The format is YYYY-MM-DD.

post_date.description: The posted date of the transaction. The format is YYYY-MM-DD.

statement_end_date.description: The statement end date to which this transaction belongs. The format is YYYY-MM-DD.

reference_number.description: The reference number/financial institution ID for display purposes.

type.description: The primary classification of the transaction as a credit or debit.

description.description: The primary description line of the transaction.

iso_alpha_currency_code.description: The ISO 4217 alphabetic currency code of the transaction.

display_account_number.description:
A masked, 15-digit display of the Account Number of the transaction.

e.g., XXXX XXXXXX 01009

amount.description: The amount of the transaction in the applicable foreign currency.

ExtendedDetails.description: Contains extended details of a transaction. These details are provided for Merchants.

Merchant.description: Merchant details associated with a specific transaction.

code.description: A numeric code associated with the error condition/scenario.

x-testInfo.description: Get statement balances for the account

elements.name: Get transactions that got posted after the last statement cut

x-testInfo.description: Get transactions for the Account for given identifier
